products.title: Toshiba Satellite L655-S5150
products.description:
The Toshiba Satellite L655-S5150 is a derivative of the midgrade L655 laptop released in mid 2010. Designed almost exclusively for business and education purposes, the Toshiba L655-S5150 houses a fast dual-core Pentium processor (2.13GHz), 4GB of DDR3 RAM, and a 320GB hard drive. Unlike some of its counterparts (e.g., L655-S5105, L655-S5105), the Satellite L655-S5150 doesn’t offer an HDMI output. It does however feature a 720p compliant display, meaning it can be used to watch some high-definition videos. On the business end, the L655-S5150 laptop comes with Ethernet, WiFi, and even a webcam, which can of course be used for video conferencing with business associates. Plus the battery is rated at 5 hours, though professionals who like to run many simultaneous apps may end up running out of juice within 4 hours.

Features

  • Windows 7 OS
  • Intel Pentium P6200
  • Mobile Intel HD Graphics
  • 4GB DDR3 RAM
  • 320GB HDD (5400rpm)
  • DVD SuperMulti
  • 15.6" Widescreen LCD
  • 720p Video Resolution
  • Built-In Webcam/Microphone
  • Standard Stereo Speakers
  • 802.11b/g/n Wireless
  • 10/100 Ethernet
  • 6-Cell Li-Ion Battery
  • Microphone/Headphone Ports
  • Memory Card Reader
  • USB 2.0 x2
  • eSATA/USB

pros.text: built wide for a full keyboard, comfortable to work with
playback of videos is in true high-definition widescreen 720p, no distortion or black bars
runs applications fast, can handle as many windows as you need without bogging down
reasonably light and easy to carry around for the size
speakers are reasonably loud, good enough for most basic things

cons.text: shows all fingerprints, needs fairly regular cleaning
ships with a collection of software of limited appeal that needs to be unloaded for efficient operation
